channel.title: STA 210: Regression Analysis on STA 210
channel.description: Recent content in STA 210: Regression Analysis on STA 210

item.description: Note: This schedule may be updated as the semester progresses. Exam dates will not be changed. Note: Icons for homework and reading appear on the day the assignment is due. Icons for labs appear on the day they are assigned. Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab AE HW Project Week 01 Mon, Aug 26 Welcome to Regression Analysis Wed, Aug 28 Review: Hypothesis Testing Introducing R and GitHub Thu, Aug 29 Lab 01: Introduction to R Week 02 Mon, Sep 2 Review: Confidence Intervals UNIT 1 CONTINUOUS RESPONSE VARIABLES Wed, Sep 4 Simple Linear Regression (SLR) Thu, Sep 5 Lab 02: Simple Linear Regression Week 03 Mon, Sep 9 SLR: Inference Wed, Sep 11 SLR Inference & Prediction Thu, Sep 12 Lab 03: Inference for SLR Week 04 Mon, Sep 16 ANOVA Wed, Sep 18 Multiple Comparisons Multiple Linear Regression (MLR) Thu, Sep 19 Lab 04: ANOVA Week 05 Mon, Sep 23 MLR: Special Predictors Wed, Sep 25 MLR: Interactions & Transformations Thu, Sep 26 Lab 05: Data Wrangling & Regression Week 06 Mon, Sep 30 MLR: Model Assessment Wed, Oct 2 MLR: Model Diagnostics Thu, Oct 3 Help Hours Week 07 Mon, Oct 7 NO CLASS - Fall Break Wed, Oct 9 Exam 01 Review Thu, Oct 10 Exam 01 Review Week 08 Mon, Oct 14 Exam 01 Wed, Oct 16 MLR: Model Selection Thu, Oct 17 Lab 06: Model Selection UNIT 2 CATEGORICAL RESPONSE VARIABLES Week 09 Mon, Oct 21 Comparing proportions & odds Wed, Oct 23 Logistic Regression: The Basics Thu, Oct 24 Lab 07: Logistic Regression: The Basics Week 10 Mon, Oct 28 Logistic Regression: Model Predictions Wed, Oct 30 Logistic Regression: Model Fit & EDA Thu, Oct 31 Lab 08: Logistic Regression: Model Fit & Prediction Week 11 Mon, Nov 4 Multinomial Regression: The Basics Wed, Nov 6 Multinomial Regression: Predictions & Drop-in Deviance Test Thu, Nov 7 Lab 09: Multinomial Logistic Regression Week 12 Mon, Nov 11 Multinomial Regression: Practice & Review Wed, Nov 13 Log-linear Regression, Part 1 Thu, Nov 14 Project Work Day Week 13 Mon, Nov 18 Model Validation & Missing Data Wed, Nov 20 Exam 02 Review Thu, Nov 21 Exam 02 Review Week 14 Mon, Nov 25 Exam 02 Wed, Nov 27 NO CLASS - Thanksgiving Break Thu, Nov 28 NO LAB - Thanksgiving Break UNIT 3 MODELING IN PRACTICE Week 15 Mon, Dec 2 Time Series Wed, Dec 4 Modeling Longitudinal Data Thu, Dec 5 Project Final Exam Period Wed, Dec 10 Project writeup & slides due at 5p Wed, Dec 11, 9a - 12p Project presentations

item.title: Policies
item.description: dashboard Click the icon to download a PDF copy of the course policies. Course Learning Objectives By the end of the semester, you willâ€¦ know methods for analyzing multivariate datasets and understand how these methods are applied in research know how to check whether proposed statistical models are appropriate for given data develop proficiency in addressing complex research questions using statistical evidence develop proficiency in computing tools used to conduct reproducible statistical analyses, specifically R and Git understand the process of data-based research by working on an independent research project Activities & Assessments The following activities and assessments will help you successfully achieve the course learning objectives.
